intro: Aconitum ramosum, commonly known as the clustered aconite, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features striking blue to purple flowers arranged in dense, branched clusters, which bloom in late summer. The plant has dark green, palmately lobed leaves that are typically hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is considered a poisonous plant and should be handled with care.
